snippet: Critics say the fact that no agent in the past two decades has been disciplined for deliberately shooting someone raises questions about the bureau’s internal investigations.
abstract: Internal Federal Bureau of Investigation records show that the FBI deemed its agents faultless in 150 shootings, from 1993 to early 2011, in which 70 subjects were killed and about 80 others wounded, raising concerns about the credibility of the bureau's shooting reviews; in most of the shootings, the FBI's internal investigation was the only official inquiry,

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: Critics say the fact that no agent in the past two decades has been disciplined for deliberately shooting someone raises questions about the bureau’s internal investigations.

headline.main: The F.B.I. Deemed Agents Faultless in 150 Shootings
headline.print_headline: The F.B.I. Deemed Agents Faultless In 150 Shootings
